Name: Bajreshwari Mata Temple
About:
The Bajreshwari Mata Temple, also known as the Kangra Devi Temple or Vajreshwari Mata Mandir, is one of the 51 Shakti Peethas, which are significant pilgrimage sites associated with the goddess.

\nIt is located in the town of Kangra, Kangra district, Himachal Pradesh, India.
Who:
Bajreshwari Mata is a form oGoddess Durga. She is worshipped as the goddess of power and strength. Her name is derived from the Sanskrit words "vajra" (thunderbolt) and "ishwari" (goddess).

\nBajreshwari Mata is said to have emerged from the left breast of Sati when her body fell to the ground after she self-immolated at her father's yagna. The place where her left breast fell is said to be the Kangra Devi Temple.

History:
The Bajreshwari Mata Temple is believed to be over 1,000 years old. The earliest mention of the temple is found in the ancient Hindu texts, such as the Puranas and the Mahabharata.The temple is said to have been built by the Katoch dynasty, which ruled Kangra for over 800 years.

\nThe temple was destroyed several times by invaders, but it was always rebuilt.In the 16th century, the temple was invaded by the Mughal emperor Akbar. Akbar ordered the destruction of the temple, but the priest of the temple, Dhayanu Bhagat, managed to save the idol of the goddess.Dhayanu Bhagat is said to have offered his head to the goddess to save her idol.

\nThe goddess is said to have accepted his sacrifice and blessed him.The temple was rebuilt again after the Mughals left Kangra. The present structure of the temple dates back to the 17th century.
